title: Dugong! Dugong! (A)
creator_contributor_role: New South Wales Film Corporation, production company
Australia Council. Aboriginal Arts Board, sponsor
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Aboriginal Australians - Legends
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Torres Strait Islands (Qld.)
description: Commencing with the telling of an Aboriginal legend about the dugong, the film then shows the hunting, killing and cooking of the dugong by the Aborigines living on Mornington Island. Hunting is now done by motor boat as opposed to the traditional method using nets, which is re-enacted.
